info.document:
A polygamous boda boda rider in Migori town on Thursday night committed suicide after his two wives fought over where he was to spend the night.

During the day, the two wives quarrelled over who would spend the night with George Otieno, 28, commonly known as Saitoti.

When he arrived at his home in Pau Nyuka village after work at about 10pm, he had supper at his younger wifeâs house and decided he would spend the night there.

He went to park his motorcycle at his first wifeâs house.

His brother Naphtali Atin told the Star that Otienoâs first wife locked the door and insisted he was to sleep in her house.

âHe took almost an hour begging the first wife to open the door for him to move to his other house, to no avail,â Atin said.

The first wife accused him of neglecting her marital and conjugal rights after marrying the second wife.

The angry man left the first womanâs house in a huff, took a rope and left his phone with the younger wife before disappearing into the night.

âThe younger wife alerted us after saying our brother left in a foul mood without speaking. We chased after him and didnât succeed,â Atin said,

Kakrao chief Pius Amara said Otieno had a history of threatening to commit suicide each time he was slighted by family members.

His body was found hanging from a tree by students going to school.

The body was removed by police and taken to Migori Referral Hospital mortuary.
